intro: Scrophularia merxmuelleri, commonly known as the Mexican scrophularia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with showy, often tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five lobes, and it produces capsule fruits containing small seeds. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
